alert.note: Alert for Baca (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 20 at 8:50PM MDT until July 20 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Baca County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 915 PM MDT. * At 849 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles southeast of Vilas, or 16 miles southeast of Springfield, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Baca County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
